name: 1500 OCEAN at the Hotel Del Coronado
review description: Awesome dinner just a few hundred yards from the coast. The wait-staff was excellent. The food likewise. We had two varieties of fish (Bass and Grouper). The waiter described everything in detail, answered questions, polite, the whole nine-yards. But not stuffy and overdone either. Just right.

name: 333 Pacific - Steaks & Seafood
review description: We have eaten at 333 Pacific twice now. The food and drinks are very good. The noise level is extreme and it is very difficult to carry on a conversation even when you speak loud. The service is slow but the servers do have good knowledge of the food and drinks. The hostesses haved a funny habit of walking through the restaurant with pen and paper marking things about the tables, it's weird.I would strongly suggest that the servers pay better attention to their customers and be more attentive.

name: 94th Aero Squadron - San Diego
review description: IT was delicious and often go there for a good time!

name: Acqua - Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa
address: 1775 E Mission Bay Dr San Diego, CA  92109
review description: We had several meals during our 4 day visit. Lunch items are the best. Staff is very nice and we saw familiar faces from over 20 years ago! They aim to please in every way!

name: Acqua Al 2 Ristorante
review description: my wife and I took a friend on Friday of Comic-Con (they were both attending). my wife and her friend shared the chefs choice sampler? 4 pasta's, three meats (New York,Fillet and Chicken) and a dessert sampler. I had the New York Ala-Orange. They absolutely enjoyed their meal and our friend was absolutely impressed with the restaurant it was her firat time. For not being a steak restaurant my steak was superb. Cooked to my temp and the hint of orange was a pleasent surprise. I had a side of pasta tha was coked perfectly and I know made fresh that day. The service at this establishment is second to none.

name: Addison at The Grand Del Mar
address: 5200 Grand Del Mar Way San Diego, CA  92130
review description: This is truly a fine dining experience that we were fortunate to have had.

name: Alchemy Restaurant
review description: I've been here for brunch and dinner and was impressed by the quality of the food on both occasions. For dinner, my boyfriend and I shared the braised masala lamb and had empanadas as an appetizer. The lamb meat was tender and full of flavor, the spinach panner was equally delicious. The empanadas were true to the Filipino style and the chili vinegar sauce was a nice and surprising complement. They had a full selection of wine but passed on it at $9 a glass. I really enjoy the laid back, artsy ambiance, mostly locals from around the area. There is an impressive steel tree in the middle of the restaurant and funky art on the walls.

name: Alexander's on 30th
review description: need to open patio for outside dining

name: Aloha Sushi Lounge & Hawaiian Grille
review description: First time there and loved the new rolls. Food was fantastic and it was such a nice relaxing atmosphere for lunch. Will def come again!

name: Amaya at The Grand Del Mar
address: 5300 Grand Del Mar Court San Diego, CA  92130
review description: I live in the neighborhood and decided to give Amaya a fourth try. Food is mediocre at best. I've tried the seabass (cold and fishy, meat was dark, bottom of the barrel quality), I've tried the halibut (lukewarm and very small not much flavor), I tried their shrimp scampi dish, cold shrimp on top of a hard vegetable with a sauce that looked and tasted liked it came out of a jar. The service is okay. Ruth's Chris in Carmel Valley is the best for food, ambiance and service!

name: Americana Restaurant
address: 1454 Camino del Mar Del Mar, CA  92014-2510
review description: Chef Randy Gruber grows his own herbs, the menu is seasonal and the restaurant is unpretentious. Service is attentive but the wait staff don't hover. The portions are generous - two could split a salad although the salads are so good, you'll want your own. The noise level is low so you can actually have a good conversation inside. The patio is dog-friendly complete with dog bowls and biscuits. The side sidewalkpatio has ocean views. The halibut is always excellent and the pastas never disappoint.

name: Aqua Terra Restaurant
review description: Outstanding food! The parmesan-crusted halibut was one of the best seafood dishes I've ever had. Absolutely flavorful and cooked to perfection. I will go back again just to have this dish! Service was impeccable.

name: Argyle Steakhouse
review description: Though food and service are outstanding what makes this dining scene fantastic is that they've paid attention to the noise or lack thereof and created a serene, comfortable space where friends can visit without shouting - a rarity in North County - or anywhere.Go - go - go - and express your appreciation for this gem!

name: Aroma Bakery and Cafe La Jolla
address: 909 Prospect St. Suite 100 La Jolla, CA  92037
review description: It was a very busy day, there was a special event going on.

name: Arterra
address: 11966 El Camino Real San Diego, CA  92130
review description: While the restaurant wasn't busy, the service was slow. Never received a refill on our drinks. The waiter never came over to inquire if the food met standards. A different experience than others; I have usually been in a much larger group; on this day there were only 3 of us...

name: Asti Ristorante
review description: We had a wonderful time at Asti and would definitely come back any day. The ambiance is nice, the food was great and the staff is very professional!

name: Avenue 5 Restaurant & Bar
review description: food was mediocre, atmosphere okay but energy picked up later in the evening, good cocktails and friendly bartenders

name: Baci Restaurant
address: 1955 West Morena Blvd San Diego, CA  92110
review description: Excellent food and service at this old style Italian gem.

name: BALEENsandiego
address: 1404 West Vacation Road San Diego, CA  92109
review description: I had made my request prior to arriving though Open Table. The restaurant has an rude hostess. "are there 4 of you?" Duh..1.me.2.my husband..3.my dad and 4 My Mom (in a wheelchair) The only people in the entire front of the restaurant. She decided to walk us into the dining room through every table moving every chair to clear way for the wheelchair. We could have been taken better path to the table. We were told the outside could not really work?Every request prior to arriving was not met.I left with my family,AND DID NOT EAT THERE.Unacceptable.I was hoping that Baleen was like I remember in the past.Upscale with Amazing food. Baleen changed and not for the better. The manager was helpful but I would rather eat somewhere else.

name: Bali Hai Restaurant
address: 2230 Shelter Island Dr San Diego, CA  92106
review description: Started off with happy hour beverages. What a delight and a treat. We had appetizers through the night with great company and remained out on the balcony for several hours. Wonderful views, very good food and service.

name: Bandar Restaurant
review description: A very classy place perfect for special occasions. The food is amazing and the portions are huge and entirely worth the price. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They really try to make your dining experience a special one.

name: Barbarella
address: 2171 Avenida De La Playa La Jolla, CA  92037
review description: Early service was disappointing, perhaps due to the dinner rush (6:30 Saturday reservation) but improved during our visit. Food was incredible.

name: BarFly La Jolla
address: 909 Prospect Street, Suite 100 La Jolla, CA  92037
review description: This was our second time here and it did not disappoint. The hostess was great to us! Our waitress was great as well! We will be making this a favorite spot!

name: Barracuda Grill
review description: This was one of the best dining experience we had. John was the best waiter. The food was excellent. We can't think of anything for them to improve. They got the quality and customer service right on.

name: Bay Club Bar & Grill
address: 2131 Shelter Island Dr. San Diego, CA  92106
review description: Nice view and good atmosphere. Food was decent, although it wasn't the best food.

name: Beach House
review description: The good: Excellent view, great ambiance, very fresh ahi tunaThe bad: very bland uninspired lobster salad, very bland uninspired mahi tacos, cold overcooked fries. As if the cook couldn't be bothered to make a fresh batch, and just put the old ones back in the oil. ok bread.

name: Beaumont's
address: 5662 La Jolla Blvd. La Jolla, CA  92037
review description: Service was great. Very attentive. the food its always awesome and different. Love the daily specials.

name: The Beer Company
review description: The Beer Co had a sports bar feel; food was average (I'll give them extra points for their loaded tater tots, though). They have a decent beer selection and their brews are pretty good as well. I thought the service was a little slow especially considering that they didn't look that busy, but they were pleasant enough, and once the food was ordered it came out pretty quickly.

name: Benihana - San Diego
address: 477 Camino del Rio S San Diego, CA  92108
review description: Good food - prepared very well by cook - enjoyed show by cook

name: Bernard'O Restaurant
address: 12457 Rancho Bernardo Road San Diego, CA  92128
review description: Our first impression upon being seated was that the restaurant was extremely noisy - too noisy for quiet conversation. Two of us ordered the halibut that came with some pea puree and vanilla sauce under the fish. The vanilla just threw the entire meal off - was NOT a pleasing or complimentary flavor to this plate - and pretty well ruined the wonderful taste of the halibut. The fish was cooked perfectly so did not need any distraction from it. Not sure who would think that vanilla was complimentary to fish. The other 2 diners had the scallops and beef bourginon - both enjoyed their meal but said the meat portions were extremely skimpy for the price paid.

name: Bertrand at Mister A's
address: 2550 Fifth Avenue, Ste 406 San Diego, CA  92103
review description: Great view of the city and bay. Amazing view of the planes landing at the airport. The steak was one of the best I've ever had.

name: BICE - San Diego
review description: Great cheese bar. Service could not be better.

name: Bistro 39
address: 3939 Ocean Bluff Ave San Diego, CA  92130
review description: This restaurant is attached to the Hilton Garden which is not noted in the Open Table listing which made it difficult to locate. Don't let that deter you from this place. The food was very good and the atmosphere is relaxed and not fancy.

name: Bistro West - Carlsbad
review description: ordered app. wanted to wait to order the waitress insisted she would hold the dinner off before we finished the app. here comes the dinner the server wainted to remove the plates we hadn't finished felt rushed it isn't a place to dine the want to turn and burn the west i will go to not bristro

name: Black and Blue Steakhouse and Lounge - Valley View Casino
address: 16300 Nyemii Pass Rd Valley Center, CA  92082
review description: Fine dining restaurant....one of my favorite places to go

name: Black Angus Steakhouse - Chula Vista
review description: We really enjoyed the abundant amount of yummy food! HOWever the server was a little off we had to ask for her a few times. it's like she brought out bill before our dinner finish and we putting in our desert requests. wierd huh??

name: Black Angus Steakhouse - El Cajon
review description: We enjoy going every time. The last occassion was my wife's birthday with the family.

name: Black Angus Steakhouse - San Diego Friars Rd.
review description: Two steaks were not cooked properly and the waiter disappeared for too long of a time. We had empty glasses for a long time. The waiter was polite and nice, but lacking in quality service.

name: Black Angus Steakhouse - San Diego Kearny
address: 5247 Kearny Villa Road San Diego, CA  92123
review description: Consistently excellent food. Our server was a little unfocused, but everyone has those kinds of days. Our filets were cooked to perfection. One member of our party had had recent open heart surgery and needed to eliminate salt. This was communicated to the server who did a good job communicating it to the chef. The manager did not make the rounds on this particular evening; something he normally does.

name: Black Angus Steakhouse - Temecula
review description: Top-notch food and service, as always; and the 30%-off coupon I was emailed by Black Angus was honored even though no worker at the location had seen that coupon before. And they let us have the larger filet mignon for the $3 higher price shown on the menu, even though we were getting the Campfire Dinner. The server hads to check with the manager on both and came back with positives on both.

name: Bleu Bohème
review description: Our entree's took a little longer than usual, but other than that, Bleu Boheme performed wonderfully as usual!

name: Blue Point Coastal Cuisine
review description: It is so nice to enjoy a restaurant where everything is first class. The service has always been fabulous and the food is outstanding. It is our first choice for quality & service. Thank you for maintaining such high standards.

name: Blue Wave Bar and Grill
review description: We eat here about once a month, so what more could I say.

name: BlueFire Grill at La Costa Resort
address: 2100 Costa Del Mar Road Carlsbad, CA  92009
review description: Placed our order via Open Table. Unfortunately, Blue Fire did not recognize our request for outdoor dining which we had put on the Open Table request. We were seated inside - but then the waiter noticed it, and said he would make it happen. So nice! So, they moved us and it was a perfect table outside. The food was amazing - soooo flavorful. Service was excellent. We would return, though it is a little bit pricey.

name: Bombay Exotic Cuisine of India
review description: I always have enjoyed your delicious lunch buffetsWe dined recently in the evening. Delicious food as always, but for the prices you're charging, the quantity could have been a bit more generous. $22 for a lamb dish consisting of 3-4 ounces of meat?? Where's the justification in that? Guess I will just go for lunch. thanks.

name: Brigantine Coronado
review description: I am a regular customer at a variety of Brigantine Restaurants in the San Diego area. I have always liked the variety of choices, the good food, and the great service.

name: Brigantine Del Mar
address: 3263 Camino Del Mar Del Mar, CA  92014
review description: I really enjoyed the food and atmosphere, and will come back, but the parking was horrendous.

name: Brigantine Escondido
review description: Waitress told us early bird was only good for the first hour after they opened. When I told her the internet said till 6"30 and our reservatin was for 6, she suddenly found menus that did say till 6:30. They did hor the early bird.We all enjoyed the food very much and loved being outside.The four of us felt that she had been instructed to do that.

name: Brigantine La Mesa
review description: One of our FAVORITE restaurants in San Diego, and we're so fortunate to have one minutes from our home. Thank you for a GREAT evening!

name: Brigantine Point Loma
address: 2725 Shelter Island Dr. San Diego, CA  92106
review description: Great food, moderate prices. They could have had a better wine list, but they have some great specialty drinks. The service is pretty good, I wish our food server had spoken better english (he didn't seem to know what a champagne cocktail was and just brought a bottle of champagne instead, which we happily drank), but my in-laws spoke spanish pretty well I guess, so we got by just fine! The fish was all great, the swordfish especially! We will go back again and again, I'm sure.

name: Brigantine Poway
review description: This was a perfect place to take a visiting out-of-town aunt for lunch. The service was wonderful (we had a trainee,) and the food was very good. We shared a mud pie for dessert- and it was so large, we couldn't finish it. (Unfortunately, mud pie doesn't do well as a left over!) I will definitely go back.

name: Brockton Villa
review description: My family and I dined here to celebrate my brother's birthday. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, first seating us indoors and then allowing us to move to the balcony when a table opened up. The view of the ocean from our table was gorgeous and we thoroughly enjoyed the ocean breeze as we ate delicious breakfast dishes. Our server was pleasant and knowledgeable of the menu, giving us great recommendations of food to try. I would definitely go back to Brockton Villa.

name: Brooklyn Girl Eatery
review description: Overall good, the calimari salad is very spicy, but does not indicate that it is.

name: Buca di Beppo - Carlsbad
review description: We had a fantastic time. We dined for our daughter's 15th birthday so it's definitely kid friendly and the service was impeccable. Come hungry since the portions are huge even when you order the small. This is a place you share food.

name: Buca di Beppo - Mira Mesa
review description: Fantastic Location, Nice Family Style Decor, best of all, Fantastic Food. Best value if you went in a group and shared, because the portions are BIG

name: Buca di Beppo - San Diego
review description: I will surely come back to this place. everything was awesome!

name: Buon Appetito
review description: We had heard many good things about Buon Appetito, both from friends who recommended it and various reviews. So we went with high expectations. We were disappointed. The food was competently prepared but not noteworthy. The pasta dishes had huge quantities of pasta, which may or may not have been freshly prepared, but were unremarkable. Sauces and spicing were boring and unimaginative. The waitstaff were attentive and helpful. Noise level was quite high, which made the experience feel more like a club or bar than a restaurant. There are few really good Italian restaurants in San Diego. Sadly, this is not one of them.

name: Burlap
address: 12995 El Camino Real Suite 21 San Diego, CA  92130
review description: Malarkey has chosen a new executive chef and it shows in the food quality!Delicious, every bite bursting with flavor. We will go back again fora special occasion.Price point is high so not a 'constant' restaurant for hubby and myself.Bar was lively after 9pm with the over 30 crowd.

name: Busalacchi's A Modo Mio
review description: Food was excellent......our server was so friendly and professional

name: Butcher Shop Steakhouse - San Diego
address: 5255 Kearny Villa Road San Diego, CA  92123
review description: Outstanding steaks. Service and attentiveness of the staff is a definite plus. Friendly environment, saw a number of regulars who knew the staff and management by name. We were here several weeks ago and needed to come back to celebrate a special occasion.

name: Café 21 – Gaslamp
review description: The food was amazing and exceeded our expectations. We enjoyed the half-price sangria flight at happy hour and then jumped in for the dinner menu. The steak with grilled waterrmelon was beautifully prepared and delicious - totally worth the extra few dollars it cost. And my partner had the zucchini bowl which she loved and I had to keep my fork away from her plate! As a birthday meal it was perfect but it could be pricey for a casual dinner. Service was wonderful and the staff was very friendly! We sat outdoors which, while a bit crowded, was great although the indoor seating was also beautiful.

name: Café 21 - University Heights
review description: Amazing food! Truly a place to experience

name: Cafe Bleu Bistro & Wine Bar
address: 807 W. Washington St. San Diego, CA  92103
review description: Warm, informal, friendly without being intrusive and best of all, excellent food and service.

name: Cafe Japengo
address: 8960 University Center Lane San Diego, CA  92122
review description: I've been going here for 25 years. It's always been fantastic.

name: Cafe Luna - San Diego
address: Cafe Luna - San Diego San Diego, CA  92128
review description: We needed a great Friday night place and found one. Excellent wait staff. Made a reservation for next week before we left.

name: Cafe Secret
address: 1140 Camino Del Mar Del Mar, CA  92014
review description: First time at a Peruvian establishment. Took a Peruvian friend who was extremely satisfied with the staff and food. Will return if in the area.

name: Cafe Sevilla - San Diego
address: 353 Fifth Avenue Cross Street Between J and K Street San Diego, CA  92101
review description: We have been to Spain on numerous occasions and therefore it is a treat to find a restaurant that serves authentic tapas and paella. The food was very good as was the service. Quite an enjoyable evening.

name: Caffe Bella Italia
review description: Authentic and delicious Italian. Homemade pasta, wide variety of dishes including seafood and beef. My son declared his wood fired pizza the best he's had (he's a true connoisseur) and my fettuccini bolognese was perfect. We will be back!

name: California Bistro - Park Hyatt Aviara
review description: We had the lunch buffet, and it was fabulous. However, just be mindful that the $5 iced tea is not included in the price and seems overpriced. I mean, come on, it's just iced tea!

name: Candelas
review description: Wonderful experience from top to bottom. The food and service was incredible. We were seated in the private wine cellar area which was encased with an iron gate and candles. Very romantic and secluded. By far the best dinner that we had while visiting San Diego. We can’t wait to return and Candelas will be number one on our list.

name: Candelas on the Bay
review description: Enjoyed a beautiful view and good food. Hostess and service staff were very accommodating.

name: Catch Carlsbad
review description: food and service is good but the price is on the high side. Even though we booked through open table they did not have our reservation when we arrived. Don't know why but they were able to accomodate us.

name: Cavaillon Restaurant
address: 14701 Via Bettona, Suite 200 San Diego, CA  92127
review description: This is a wonderful local restaurant. We want to try & encourage people in the neighborhood to go. The chef is very creative & the food is always wonderful!

name: Chandler's - Hilton Carlsbad Oceanfront Resort & Spa
review description: Although Chandler's is a new restaurant, many of us locals know the Executive Chef from his most recent restaurant, Savory. Pascal has a put together a lunch menu that pleased everyone. For my birthday instead of having cake (which is not my favorite) I had a pot de creme' (sic). For a new restaurant the service was very good. Ladies who Lunch will be back again.

name: Charisma Cucina Italiana
review description: Hands down one of our favorite places to eat. We are always looking for a reason to eat here. Food is great, servers all speak Italian and are quick with any requests. Can get busy on a Friday or Saturday night, but still we have never had to wait more than 5 mins for a table.

name: Chart House Restaurant - Cardiff
review description: Food was terrific and we had a great time. The sunset view was unbelievable!

name: Chedi Thai Bistro
address: 737 Pearl St. Suite 110 La Jolla, CA  92037
review description: My family has a few Thai friends, one who often cooks us Thai food. So we know what good Thai curry and pad Thai are like. We thought this restaurant which has been around for over a year in La Jolla would have to be pretty decent to make it thus far. However It was very sub- par and truthfully there are so many great restaurants in this area. Don't waste your time on this one unless you don't want to go far and want a decent but not great meal.

name: Chianti Restaurant
review description: It's in the heart of Downtown San Diego in the Gaslamp. So great location in the heart of the action. I mentioned it was my BDay when we put in the Open Table reservation and it was not acknowledged. Also order was messed up-no biggie on that. I thought the food was ok, maybe a bit pricey based on the quality. Those that want Italian and have the ability to travel a couple of miles might have better luck in Little Italy. But the Gaslamp is always a un dinner spot.

name: Cicciotti's
review description: My new favorite! i have live here for 8 years an only recently went to this neighborhood restaurant and I am so pleased I finally tried it. The service is friendly and professional, the food maybe the best in North County and the prices are reasonable. I love the wood fire in the bar and the Pizza is wonderful. Try it, you won't be disappointed.

name: Club M at The Grand Del Mar
address: 5200 Grand Del Mar Way San Diego, CA  92130
review description: The entire evening experience was great, from the food and service, to the really entertaining dance band Pete Johnson. Really enjoyed the night and would certainly come back when they are playing again, just made for a perfectly fun time.

name: Coronado Boathouse 1887
review description: Went to Coronado Beachhouse 1887 to celebrate my daughter's graduation - it was a great experience. The waiter told us stories about the history of the place and suggested great fish to eat. Had a great bottle of wine - and when the four of us finished it off before dinner was over, our waiter let us know that we could order more by the glass rather than encouraging us to get another bottle which would have made it difficult to drive home safely. He also brought a special dessert to help my daughter celebrate - and there was enough of it for all of us to share!It was not inexpensive - $250 for four - but it was a great place for a special celebration - I'd recommend it!

name: Cosmopolitan Restaurant
review description: First, the live music by the Euphoria Brass Band was fantastic. The $5 BBQ and house wines were wonderful; notably high quality and low price. MUSIC 7 DAYS A WEEK!The sour note? The staff had no clue how to handle the live music and dining combination:staff did not understand the BBQ ticket system and reservations were ignored resulting in those who planned ahead ending up with their meal out of sight or sound of the entertainment because of people without reservations.

name: Cowboy Star
review description: Pricey, bad seating and unimpressive beef might have made for a less then remarkable night at Cowboy Star. I had no delusions of leaving C~Star without spending some money, not counting the healthy pours of Bourbon and decent wine list, the food, especially the beef did not live up to the hype and cost.

name: Crab Catcher
review description: I went there to celebrate a birthday with friends...our experience was great! We had great service, an amazing view of the sea caves and La Jolla Cove, and great food! Our waiter went out of his way to fill our specific request...and our champagne was kept filled before we even noticed it was low (we went for the champagne brunch) And the seafood was outstanding- the crab especially was sweet and good! Thank you Crab Catcher for a great day with friends!

name: Crab Hut
review description: Amazing food a bit pricey but well worth it!!! Food was delicious and the experience was so fun I really enjoyed myself!!!!

name: Croce's Restaurant & Jazz Bar
review description: Great food, fun place to hang out, super music.

name: Crossroads at House of Blues - San Diego
review description: Unfortunately, I can't recommend too much based on our recent experience at Crossroads. It is convenient if you are attending a show at the House of Blues and they have a good beer selection for just $3 during happy hour, but that's where my positive review ends. The service was really slow. There were multiple billing errors and the food was just "ok".

name: Crush - Solana Beach
address: 437 S. Coast Highway Suite 112 Solana Beach, CA  92075
review description: Great, fun, modern decor. Inside was vibrant...ok, loud. Outside patio was better for dinner conversation. Hostess and server were both very friendly.

name: CUCINA urbana
review description: They charred my burger. And the tomatoes with the burrata were not great. And the spring lamb bolognese rigatoni was just OK. Service was great. And the setting is great.

name: Currant American Brasserie
review description: Food was good. I recommend the fiery brussel sprouts. Restaurant was loud, but there seemed to be a lot of people having fun.

name: Current - Coronado Island Marriott Resort
review description: We made last minute reservations for the Tgiving buffett and we really enjoyed it.The food was great, festive atmosphere, great service and great for kids too.

name: de Medici Cucina Italiana
review description: Our server Juan was fantastic. The seafood cannelloni appetizer is to die for if you like a vodka cream sauce. I used the bread to eat the excess sauce. The Cesar salad is excellent and they make fresh Cesar salad dressing at table side. My son who does not like anchovies in his Cesar Salad but really enjoyed this Salad. He was surprised how good it was with it (they use a paste that enhanced the flavors). The veal Milanese is huge so bring a big appetite. I do not drink coffee black but I did, It is with the four different liquors, spices and various zest used this after dinner coffee was excellent; so if you want something out of the ordinary, you should order the cafe diablo. Also the preparation is table side is a spectacle in its self

name: Del Mar Rendezvous
address: 1555 Camino Del Mar, Suite 102 Del Mar, CA  92014
review description: Fabulous, innovative and fresh, fresh food that pops with flavor. Prices are more than reasonable and the staff is warm, friendly and helpful if you have trouble deciding which of the many and varied dishes to order.

name: Delicias
address: 6106 Paseo Delicias Rancho Santa Fe, CA  92067
review description: Delicias has up'd its game. Paul McCabe has done wonders to this well-known restaurant. The food was innovative and delicious. The concept with small, medium and larger plates let my girlfriends and I share a very social meal - exactly what we wanted. The room has been updated and has a touch of modern thrown in. I wish they would've done a little more, only because Paul's food and effervescent personality deserves it. I'll be back.

name: Dick's Last Resort - San Diego
review description: Great fun! A great way to unwind after a long meeting! Lots of laughs and we weren't rushed. It was the first time for all of us and we all had a great time. The food and drinks were good.

name: Dobson's Bar & Restaurant
review description: Worth a trip for the bisque en croute alone, but come for the warm clubby ambiance, fun crowd and friendly service. Waiter Mike, bartender Rene, and owner Paul Dobson (a former matador!) and the rest of the longtime team make every visit a treat. Plus, the classic cuisine delights the whole crowd--even finicky or snobby types.

name: Dolce Pane E Vino
address: 16081 San Dieguito Rd. Rancho Santa Fe, CA  92067
review description: We just LOVE Dolce! It's great fun to bring guests along for their first visit! So HAPPY to have this restaurant in the neighborhood!

name: Eddie V's - La Jolla
review description: Outstanding food, service and presentation. They do it right.

name: The Edge Restaurant and Lounge
address: 28544 Old Town Front St. Temecula, CA  92590
review description: Extremely disappointed! So overpriced it is ridiculous! My wife's food (scallops and prawns) was so bland and lacking flavor it tasted like rubber, I had the T-bone steak and it was probably the worst cut I have ever had a resturant. $30.00 to $35.00 for an entree that quite frankly was not ant better than eating a Norms! it wasa really sad way to celebrate our 30th wedding aniversary!

name: El Agave
address: 2304 San Diego Ave. San Diego, CA  92110
review description: Euro-Mexican food, in the sense of going back to its native roots. Many kinds of mole, corn fungus (cuitlacoche), unusual and rich flavors. Replace wine cave with tequila menu and museum. Good place to take visitors from cities with rich and unusual dining and show them what San Diego offers.

name: El Bizcocho at Rancho Bernardo Inn
address: 17550 Bernardo Oaks Dr San Diego, CA  92128
review description: we love love love el bizcocho for sunday brunch!!!

name: El Callejon - Encinitas
address: 345 Pacific Coast Hwy 101,Suite C2 Encinitas, CA  92024
review description: Good restaurant Open Table reservation with them is worthless because they don't have anyone following through with them. Call directly instead.

name: El Callejon - Vista
address: 20 Main St. Suite H100 Vista, CA  92083
review description: A great place with a varied menu, all your favorites & more.

name: El Vitral Restaurant
review description: Happy Hour Specials were fantastic.

name: Fat Fish Cantina Grill
review description: it was a very good overall experience

name: Fiddlers Green Restaurant
address: 2760 Shelter Island Dr San Diego, CA  92106
review description: Some people really love this place passionately.

name: Fig Tree Cafe - Hillcrest
review description: We had a pleasurable experience. We enjoyed our meal. We sat outside and there was the occasional loud vehicle driving by that halted our conversation, but it was brief. Our server, Gina, was a sweetheart and fun. Definitely a place to visit again and try more items from the menu!

name: Finch's Bistro & Wine Bar
review description: Our party of 6 had a most enjoyable evening. Everyone loved their food and wine and the music. This restaurant has become our favorite go to place.

name: Firefly Grill & Wine Bar
address: 251 N. El Camino Real Suite B Encinitas, CA  92024
review description: The service was very poor throughout our evening. The waiter was inattentive from the beginning, the one cocktail ordered sat at the bar for several minutes - took at least 15 minutes and someone else had to deliver it. The food was served to the wrong person and basically just dropped at the table. I worked in the restaurant business and know you can get busy, but this waiter was inattentive and had poor customer service - it may be he was busy too, but there's a way to work with your customers even when you are busy.

name: Firenze Trattoria
address: 162 South Rancho Santa Fe Road Encinitas, CA  92024
review description: My wife and I eat at Firenze's often. We especially enjoy the patio, it's quieter and when we have guest it's easier to talk.

name: The Fish Market
address: 750 North Harbor Drive San Diego, CA  92101
review description: As always, great food with an amazing view.

name: The Fishery
review description: Excellent seafood in residential neighborhood. all fish fresh and wild caught.

name: Flavor Del Mar
address: 1555 Camino Del Mar #322 Del Mar, CA  92014
review description: We were very disappointed in Flavor. We'd heard about the restaurant and were eager to try it. Risotto was ridiculous, like minute rice at best. Prawns were overcooked and hard; we didn't even eat them. Profiteroles were stale, and tasted like the day-old dessert from bakery. Vanilla bean ice cream was tasteless. We won't go back. Next time, we'll visit Pacifica next door, one of our favorites.

name: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - La Jolla
address: 8970 University Center Lane La Jolla, CA  92122
review description: Excellent steaks. The 3-course Prix Fixe dinner is a great deal! Gets very noisy once the dining room fills up, so go early or late if you want a quiet dinner.

name: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - San Diego
review description: Entire staff was outstanding - not just professional, but super friendly and made our dining experience memorable. The food was excellent - the molten cake superb. However it is the staff at this location that takes it over the top.

name: Fratelli's Italian Kitchen
review description: Great food- and better service. They accommodated our gluten-free needs with no problem. We are from out of town, but they are clearly a popular restaurant with the locals, as we saw several customers arrive that the staff were obviously familiar and friendly with. Would definitely return here.

name: The French Gourmet
review description: The food is absolutely fabulous!! Do the wine pairing flight. The pairings are spot on and totally compliment your course. The service is fantastic and Michael is very attentive and do let him make choices for you. This is a family favorite for our special occasions.

name: French Market Grille
address: 15717 Bernardo Heights Pkway San Diego, CA  92128
review description: The restaurant advertised a Bastille Day dinner special that filled every seat in the house. They were not prepared for the turnout, although they had to know, everyone had a reservation. They were understaffed, the service was very poor, there was no one running the front of the house. They even ran out of silverware. The food on the special menu was not up to the restaurants usual standards.

name: Fresco Grill
review description: There were 8 people in our group. One couple were x-restaurant owners and said everything was perfect and they have told me it's now their number one Italian restaurant. We get together once a month an try different restaurants in a 30 mile area. This place was a hit and will be coming back.

name: Fresco Trattoria & Bar
review description: We eat at this restaurant quite often when we cme here for the summer. The food is alway excellent and very generous portions at great prices. Service and drinks vey good to. We took friends from Newport Beach there this week and they said the veal was the best!

name: Gabardine
review description: The food seems to be getting better, the service was great....still too noisy.

name: The Gambling Cowboy Chophouse and Saloon
review description: We recently moved to Temecula and saw this place in Old Town and immediately thought it might be a tourist trap with fair food and expensive prices. Then our neighbor told us they frequent the bar for their dinner specials and love the food, so we thought we should give it a try. Oh my goodness....soooo good! My husband can be a food snob and after his first bite of prime rib said, "I would definitely come back." We wanted to try everything so ordered too much food - an appetizer, salad and entree, but the good thing is we were able to enjoy it the next night as leftovers.

name: George's California Modern
review description: The prices did not match the food quality. Ambiance was good but I felt more like I was contributing to the rent than paying for a good dining experience.

name: George's Ocean Terrace
review description: Slow service at the end of the meal

name: Gourmet India
review description: Great night out my wife and I had, we were in town for vacation for one week, our great friends baby sat for us and my wife and I went out on a date night in the gas lamp district like we did many years ago, so I looked up opentable and found this fantastic indian restaurant , food was amazing , wine was half price, so we had two lol, Tuesday night ! Overall great night out, plus we got 1000 points on opentable for this visit, thanks guys.

name: Gourmet Italia
review description: we had a 7pm reservation which was not honored...we were kept waiting at least 15minutes...then we waited another 30minutes after placing our order for the salad course to arrive which was incorrect (contained balsamic vinegar which my wife had definitely said she could not eat and did not want)..the main dishes were fine (albeit luke warm)...I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone regardless of how good the food tasted....

name: Grant Grill
review description: Creative menu in a classic setting with exquisite service. Homemade bread to die for. Bartender Bruce is a gem--be sure to visit him before or after a meal, or anytime for fresh, inventive cocktails made with the finest ingredients.

name: Greystone The Steakhouse
review description: Great dinner even for late night...good service....live music in the bar was hard to talk over

name: Grove Steakhouse at Viejas Casino
review description: This was an excellent steak house. The steaks were delicious, they melted in your mouth. I had the crab bisque and it was the best I had ever tasted. I would highly recommend it and would definately go back.

name: Herringbone
review description: Other than a Noise level that was very high, almost drowning out all normal conversation, this restaurant is now my favorite place for food, ambiance, and service!

name: Hexagone
review description: Good for theater at Balboa Park

name: Humphreys Restaurant
address: 2241 Shelter Island Drive San Diego, CA  92106
review description: You can't find a better place that has it all! The very best.

name: Ichiban Sushi Japanese Restaurant
review description: Great sushi place in the greater San Diego area. Fish is fresh, or at least doesn't taste fishy like at any other place I've tried, reasonable prices (too bad they got rid of the 50% off menu at happy hour - $2 hand rolls were hard to beat - but the 30% off is still there), relaxing ambiance except for the terrible music.

name: Ignite Bistro
review description: We ordered a $20 Ribeye and $25 Filets Oscar, and sent both back for being overcooked-the first time we have done so in 30 years of dining out together. We requested Medium Rare. The filets were Medium Well, the Ribeye Well Done with no char on the outside. It was an anemic gray color. The waitress, a sweet, pretty girl but CLUELESS and timid--explained that an employee cut the steaks too thin, therefore it was difficult to cook such a thin steak anything but well done. And I have to agree. The ribeye was as thin as a bone-in supermarket pork chop. It had to be 1/4 inch thick (or thin!!). Why serve steaks that were incorrectly cut too thin and charge $20!!! We won't be back.

name: Il Fornaio - Coronado
review description: An odd experience. Gorgeous location, yet the way the servers behave, you'd think you were in a roadhouse. Carts full of dishes rattling so loudly you had to pause your conversation til they passed by, wheeled right down the middle of the dining room. A waitress admiring my friend's dress actually reached down and stroked the fabric! Most unsettling of all, my waitress picked up the wine menu before we had opened it, and started to take it away. Confused, I asked her to leave it for us, and she said "Well, this is the Reserve list, $50 and up only." !!!! I was flaggergasted. As if it were somehow unthinkable to her that we might order a nice bottle of wine?! (which we did btw). Bizarre. Food was decent but not good enough to come back here.

name: Il Fornaio - Del Mar
address: 1555 Camino Del Mar Del Mar, CA  92014
review description: Wonderful Place!! Great food!!! Will be back.

name: Indigo Grill
review description: An extremely bold and successful variety of flavors on both dishes we tried! Great job of staying away from a 'cookie cutter' twist on a southwestern theme.

name: Inn at the Park / Top of the Park Restaurant - Park Manor Suites
review description: Our waiter Frank was awesome!!! Food was terrific!! Gotta go back!!!

name: Island Prime
address: 880 Harbor Island Drive San Diego, CA  92101
review description: The overall experience was good, but the mussels were awful. They were very fishy and the sauce was very bland. Usually it is great to dip bread in the sauce but not this time. Otherwise the lobster bisque & steaks were very tasty.

name: Jack & Giulio's Italian Restaurant
address: 2391 San Diego Ave San Diego, CA  92110
review description: Food was good but the menu is rather limited. Veal Picata was superb as weee veal parmigiana and eggplant Parm.

name: Jai by Wolfgang Puck
address: 2910 La Jolla Village Dr. La Jolla, CA  92037
review description: Our servers were gracious when they eventually were able to attend our table . It seemed that the restaurant managers cut their wait staff and the customers were at the short end of the stick. We waited 15 minuets for a server to attend our table and take our cocktail order.

name: Jake's Del Mar
review description: Front hostess stuck up and not so pleasant. Had a 9:15 res and got there 45 minutes early in hope of getting seated earlier since we had our 3 & 4 year old with us. Not a chance and even got seated 20 minutes after our reservation time even though she said she will seat us at 9:15. We were the only ones waiting for a table at the end, reminded me of something about Mary when Ben stiller was trying to board the plane.Other than that, the food was superb and our server was attentive and made great recommendations.

name: JRDN Restaurant
review description: The food is beautifully presented and very flavorful. Service was very good.

name: Jsix Restaurant
review description: Loved the Chef's Mercy. I'm sure the regular menu was fantastic as well, but there's something really cool about having the chef design a meal on the spot. Price was very reasonable ($59 for 5 courses, $79 w/ a wine pairing) and they were even able to accommodate the fact that my friend (keeps kosher) and I (pregnant) could and couldn't eat very different things. Would come back just for that menu item.

name: Katsuya - San Diego - SBE
review description: An uber-hip restaurant, Katsuya is a Nobu knockoff that reminds us of how good Nobu was in the early days. Can't beat the creative cocktails and seafood preparations. The only problems with the restaurant are the noise level (high) and the pace of service (all the dishes came at once). It's also a pretty hip crowd so oldsters (like us) may feel a little uncomfortable.

name: kelvin
address: 421 W B Street San Diego, CA  92101
review description: The new restaurant has an interesting and colorful theme. Staff were very friendly and offerred suggestions. The topas style portions are great for sharing and trying several items. Larger entrees are available, but you must ask for them. The duck quesadillas were great!

name: Kensington Grill
review description: A decent, modern with a modest menu but good variety. A safe bet for a first date.

name: KITCHEN 1540
address: 1540 Camino Del Mar Del Mar, CA  92014
review description: Excellent service with good menu. Our combined opinion is that we like the previous menu better.

name: Kous Kous Moroccan Bistro
review description: Our first time to a Moroccan restaurant. The waiter was very friendly and helpful explaining the dishes and making recommendations. The food was all delicious. The chicken tagine was just melt in your mouth delicious as was the lamb shank. We will be going back.

name: La Bastide Bistro
address: 10006 Scripps Ranch Blvd, #104 San Diego, CA  92131
review description: It is a neighborhood gem! Great food, great service. The owners Gigi and Victor are there to greet you and make sure your are welcomed. Go back often. Recommend if you want to get away from the 'norm' of restaurants.

name: La Bella Pizza
review description: Great place..just like good old east coast back in the 90"s..but kid friendly

name: La Dolce Vita Ristorante
address: 1237 Prospect St Ste P La Jolla, CA  92037
review description: Fantastic! Food was delicious. I plan on returning to experience other wonderful dishes.

name: La Fiesta
review description: Food came out great. the Server is very attentive. good portions, huge margaritas that are very strong. My nieces, my sister and my bf all love the place

name: La Gran Terraza - University of San Diego
review description: Great dining for all of the reasons checked above and probably many more that we haven't experienced yet!

name: Lael's Restaurant
review description: It's your standard hotel brunch buffet. The food was good and fresh. The service was ditzy - nice but generally unavailable (more water, please?).

name: Le Papagayo
review description: We love this place! Have never had a bad meal - and the sangria is wonderful!

name: Leroy's Kitchen + Lounge
review description: A real gem. After a day at the beach, if you are looking for something that is healthy, friendly, delicious and even a little bit decadente then head over to Leroy's. The food ranged from delicious burgers with truffle fries to beet salad to yummy salmon benedict or sweet fruit granola and yogurt. The staff was very friendly and helpful and seemed to really enjoy their job. Another great plus, if you are a doggy lover, is that they have outdoor seating that is mutt friendly. They even brought out a water dish for our thirsty dog. The price was right too as nothing was overpriced.

name: Lighthouse Bar & Grill
review description: We have been enjoying The Lighthouse since they opened and have found the food and the service consistently wonderful. It is becoming a neighborhood favorite and run into many people we know from sailing as well as just the Point Loma area. The meals are very, very good, the portions are generous and the service is wonderful.

name: Lobby Lounge - Park Hyatt Aviara
review description: My mother, sister, and I always love going to high tea on special occasions! The food is always delicious, service outstanding, and the ambiance is always relaxing and fun!

name: Lotus Thai - Downtown
review description: We went there for lunch and enjoyed everything.

name: Lotus Thai - Hillcrest
review description: Ambience was great, food was awesome and the perfect Thai food in the area.

name: Lou & Mickey's
review description: We were seated at a lovely table and served by a very attentive wait staff. Very friendly and knowledgeable and quite professional. Food was excellent. No corkage fees, so we brought our favourite wine. Gotta love that! A great night out!

name: Manhattan of La Jolla
review description: This was a wonderful classy place for a nice dinner. Lots to choose from and you really can't go wrong with what you order!

name: The Marble Room
review description: The customer service was absolutely superb. We made reservations for a patio table at 6:45pm. When we arrived we were informed that some guests had been here since 4pm and they had not anticipated them remaining so long. They offered us a free cocktail while they sorted out the situation. We were still seated on the patio by 7:10pm.

name: Marina Kitchen - San Diego Marriott Marquis & Marina
address: 333 West Harbor Drive San Diego, CA  92101
review description: poor menu of salads- no shrimp no salmon

name: The Marine Room
review description: The commitment to an elevated dining experience shows in every aspect of your visit to the Marine Room. From the friendly hostesses, the superlative wait staff, to the tiniest touches that decorates each plate. You can tell that work went into the planning and compilation of every menu item, the layers of flavor delight at every turn. The food is as beautiful on the tongue as it is on the plate. So much attention is devoted to perfecting the balance of flavors and the details of the presentation that you cannot help but feel special, as if the chef prepared each dish especially for you.

name: Market Cafe at Loews Coronado Bay Resort
address: 4000 Loews Coronado Bay Road Coronado, CA  92118
review description: I was dissappointed upon arrival to see such an informal atmosphere and even more dissappointed when I saw the menu. We expected a steak house as I have read in the profile of the hotel's website, that this cafe transformed into a steak house at dinner time, it was still a cafe with only steak burgers in the menu, but no real steaks. Well, we were already there after driving a bit so, we decided to stay. The chicken achiote that I ordered, had more the taste of a saffron chicken rather than achiote. Being a pretty decent gourmet cook myself, I was greatly dissappointed to the Father's Day celebration I planned for my husband.

name: Market Restaurant and Bar
address: 3702 Via de la Valle Del Mar, CA  92014
review description: The best resturant in San Diego

name: Martinis Above Fourth
address: 3940 Fourth Ave. Suite 200 San Diego, CA  92103
review description: The best array of martinis I've seen! Happy hour prices can't be beat.

name: Masala Spices of India
review description: The service at Masala was indisputably the worst I have ever experienced. My husband and I were kept waiting for over an hour despite being told mulitple times that we would be seated at the next available table because the hostess opted to seat other guests (groups of three people, whereas we were only two) each time a table opened up. Both groups arrived after we did and, unlike us, did not have a reservation. After an hour, we ended up leaving hungry and frustrated. The hostess and manager were aware of the situation and did not even offer to comp the drinks we had at the bar while we were waiting. Suffice it to say I will never go back; there are plenty of other Indian food restaurants that know how to run a business in the Gaslamp.

name: McCormick & Schmick's Seafood - San Diego
address: 675 L Street Omni Hotel San Diego, CA  92101
review description: A great place to relax and enjoy a meal! Lunch was quick and delicious ?

name: The Mediterranean at La Valencia Hotel
review description: WE had an exceptional dinner! We'll be back!

name: The Melting Pot - Gaslamp Quarter
review description: My wife and I came here for our 3 year wedding anniversary. They had a card signed by the staff and rose pedals on the table when we arrived. Very cool. Our waiter Steven was great, very helpful as it was our first time dining here. Good place for adults to have a nice dinner, something different. Great experiance.

name: The Melting Pot - La Jolla
address: 8980 University Center Lane San Diego, CA  92122
review description: Great food.Everything we ate was delicious.Great service.Very knowledgeable, helpful, always right there, without being intrusive.Enjoyed it a lot!

name: The Merk Bistro
review description: I have visited The Merk multiple times when traveling to San Diego - the food is always great. Aside from an isolated encounter with one of their hostess/waitresses, the service has always been great as well. I love that they serve breakfast until 2pm so I can still get breakfast for lunch if I want (I finally got to try chilaquiles) and they have a great deal on bottomless mimosas - you don't have to beg for the next one, they just keep bringing them!Even if you don't stop in for dinner - go see Shay at the bar and have him make you a REAL margarita on the rocks. No nasty bottled mix at this bar!

name: Mia Francesca Del Mar
address: 12955 El Camino Real G-4 San Diego, CA  92130
review description: Great restaurant! Food and ambiance is superb. Parking can be difficult but they have valet...

name: Mille Fleurs
address: 6009 Paseo Delicias Rancho Santa Fe, CA  92067
review description: I had been to Mille Fleurs once before, so I wanted to take my friends. We were in Rancho Sante Fe, for another event, so it was also convenient.

name: Mistral at Loews Coronado Bay Resort
address: 4000 Loews Coronado Bay Rd. Coronado, CA  92118
review description: Food, service, ambience and views were superb. Had tried the Del Coronado the night before and there was no comparison. Would definitely return to Mistral.

name: Monsoon Fine Cuisine of India
review description: The food was decent, but expensive. And $20 for the buffet was too much considering the limited selection.

name: Morton's The Steakhouse - San Diego
review description: The best steak I have ever had. The black truffle butter is a great pair with the filet. Would definitely go back.

name: Mustangs & Burros at Estancia La Jolla
address: 9700 N. Torrey Pines Rd San Diego, CA  92037
review description: While the outside area is very small, it is beautiful and a great place to share a few appetizers and a bottle of wine. We would return again.

name: Muzita Abyssinian Bistro
review description: A bit miserly with the injera. At other Ethiopian restaurants, they often brought an entire basket with more than just a piece per diner.

name: Nick's at the Beach
review description: It's a joint. Nothing special - the food is predictable and average. It's close to the beach, but not on it. Lacking pzzazz.

name: Nick's at the Pier
address: 5083 Santa Monica Ave. (TOP FLOOR) San Diego, CA  92107
review description: The location is outstanding, the service was impeccable, the servers were most animated and personable, the overall experience was exceptional.

name: Nicolosi's Italian Restaurant
review description: The linquini with clam sauce had great flavor, but the clams were very tough. Also had to ask the waitress for utensils, bread and water, which was dissappointing.

name: NINE-TEN
review description: The quality of the food, service and decor of this up-scale restaurant make it a natural to be a special occasion selection. Unfortunately, going to this not inexpensive restaurant for a special occasion is not a good choice as one is surrounded by diners in shorts, t-shirts and flips. This is especially the case in the summer. For that special evening choose another high-end restaurant whose customers don't look like they're dining at a burger joint.

name: Nobu San Diego
review description: Overall excellent food as you would expect for Nobu (I have eaten at the New York and LA versions), but not as excellent as you would expect for the price. Hugely overpriced for what is was at lunch. It may have been price gouging for ComicCon. It did sour my taste for wanting to return

name: Nugent's Firegrille Restaurant
address: 12015 Scripps Highland Dr San Diego, CA  92131
review description: Service/food delivery pretty slow. Restaurant wasn't too busy, so not sure what the delay was for. Food was good, so we'll be back.

name: Ocean Room
review description: What a pleasant and delightful surprise. The Japanese Soup was outstanding! The prices very good and the service impeccable.

name: Oceanaire Seafood Room - San Diego
address: 400 J Street Gaslamp District San Diego, CA  92101
review description: Came here in a rush before a play at the San Diego civic theatre. Deffinitley need to come back to enjoy everything. Started off with the amazing crab cakes very good and reccomend! The fish was amazing I believe I had the sea bass and it was really good! Did not have time for the dessert but the next time we stop in I will make sure to leave room for their specialty dessert! Deffinitley coming back!

name: Operacaffe
review description: I only went in to try the Beef Carpaccio. It was excellent.

name: Ortega's  A Mexican Bistro
review description: The Kobe beef burritos are superb.

name: Osetra The Fishhouse
review description: Service was fantastic food was fantastic great value for what your spending will recommend to everyone

name: Pacific Beach Alehouse
review description: Fantastic craft beer. The brewmaster is terrific. He sat at our table and talked to us about troubleshooting Dad's home brew and walked us through his own process.

name: Pacifica Del Mar
address: 1555 Camino del Mar Del Mar, CA  92014
review description: Always a great place to relax with good food and a beautiful view.

name: Palm Restaurant - San Diego
review description: Excellent service and food as always!

name: Pamplemousse Grille
address: 514 Via de la Valle,  Suite 100 Solana Beach, CA  92075
review description: Wonderful food, professional and impeccable service, in an unpretentious atmosphere.

name: Pantry of Rancho Santa Fe
address: 6024 C Paseo Delicias Rancho Santa Fe, CA  92067
review description: Pleasant and attentive staff in a quaint neighborhood restaraunt. It was so good the first night that we returned the second night in a row with equally good results.

name: PAON Restaurant & Wine Bar
review description: Great experience. Will go back for sure.

name: Peohe's – Coronado Waterfront Restaurant
review description: Decided to try this restraunt after many years. We had a nice table looking over the restraunt and some waterfront views. Our waitress was very nice, slow, but attentive. We apreciated the time between salads,the meals and desert (highlight). Our waters stayed empty most of the night, refilled once. The meal (primerib) was overcooked and very dry and the plate was not very well prepped. The other meal was a special, shrimp trio. The shrimp were overcooked and not well presented on the plane plate. Each plate could have had more items accompanying the meals.We were not pleasaed with the experience and we were ready to leave.

name: Piatti - La Jolla
address: 2182 Avenida de la Playa La Jolla, CA  92037
review description: Needs help with their waiters attentiveness.

name: Pinnacle Restaurant - Falkner Winery
review description: Great location, view and restaurant floor plan...but the facility needs to be enhanced if to be taken really seriously. The wooden floors and poor ceiling acoustics make the place sound very noisy, like a military cafeteria. Interior look is pretty drab, most notably the fake half columns, only to be made up for by the window views. Again, this is another Temecula, volume oriented, operation that lacks intimacy and personality. Too bad...

name: Pinzimini-The Westin Gaslamp Quarter, San Diego
review description: service, food and atmosphere was great- definitely a must in the gaslamp area.

name: Po Pazzo Bar & Grille
review description: a good place but for what you get it's over priced.

name: Poseidon
review description: We waited 40 minutes for our table WITH a reservation. Food was decent but nothing special and overpriced for what you got. Really great waitstaff however (not their fault the management overbooked). Plan on limiting my visits here to appetizers and cocktails in the future.

name: The Prado at Balboa Park
review description: The restaurant was really pretty. It was well staffed with friendly people and the food was great.

name: Prepkitchen - Little Italy
review description: Awesome! It was my best friend's birthday and we had a great time. I made reservations for 6:45 and my friend got out of work almost an hour late. I sat in the restaurant by myself for about an hour waiting for her. The staff was awesome. They kept bringing me water, they brought me a snack tray... everyone was really nice. I felt bad for taking up the table for so long, but the waiters were great. Our meal was delicious. It was a great time and I will definitely be back. I've already recommended it to other people!

name: Primavera Ristorante- Coronado
review description: Ordered the Lobster Risotto; I think I received the "Loobster" instead - very rubbery and disappointing. My husband ordered the Chicken Parm - he seemed to enjoy his meal more than I did. Went there based upon Zagats rating - WAY off! Food was average and unremarkable. I would not go back. However, the service was outstanding!

name: Prospect Bar & Grill
review description: our server and the guy playing the acoustic guitar that afternoon was great. thanks.

name: Q'ero
review description: Overall, this restaurant is excellent. The only negative part of our experience this time was that our server was not very good. I felt like he judged us based on how we looked (a younger couple that perhaps didn't make as much money as his other customers), and wasn't as attentive to us as he was to his other tables. This was somewhat surprising to me because we've dined there before and had an excellent server. However, that aside, the food is excellent. Just make sure to get a reservation in advance, otherwise you won't be able to get in since it's a small restaurant that's quite popular.

name: R Gang Eatery
review description: Food was great! Richard the owner greeted us, and Amy our server was all over us!!! Great service!

name: Rama - San Diego
review description: Excellant as always. Enjoy coming here.

name: The Range Kitchen and Cocktails
review description: Good food, good beer, good & entertaining staff. It was a little noisy, but to be expected in a bar stool style place. I would go back again.

name: Ravioli Osteria
address: 40711 Murrieta Hot Springs Road Murrieta, CA  92563
review description: We always have a great meal here. It was very quiet as it was a Monday night but we had a full choice of bar and menu items. Our server was very attentive and made great suggestions when asked for his recommendations. Portions are always generous. The special shrimp/crab stuffed raviolis were delicious. Although located in a small mall off of Murieta Hot Springs Rd. the ambiance once inside is intimate and gracious. A nice place for a romantic dinner or appetizers and drinks at the bar.

name: The Red Door
address: 741 W. Washington St. San Diego, CA  92103
review description: Delicious food, great service Love the garden grown, fresh vegetables and the tender cuts of meat.

name: Red Light District
review description: Very cool spot. Definitely recommend the tasting menu so you can get a bit of everything. Neil Guillen and everybody else we encountered were spectacular!

name: Red Marlin Waterfront Restaurant Bar and Terrace
review description: The service was awesome. She helped us get what we wanted on the menu to the point that we had to come back later in the week to have our favorites before we left. Favorites? The Clam Chowder and the Blackened Swordfish. Our waitress even gave us recommendations on what to do in walking distance and places to go around town.

name: Red Pearl Kitchen - Gaslamp
address: 440 J Street, Suite #108 San Diego, CA  92101
review description: Overall food was good. Just needed something more. Maybe like a stir fried udon with black pepper beef/filet mignon. Although food was good it lacked in so many ways.

name: Red Tracton's
address: 550 Via De La Valle Solana Beach, CA  92075
review description: Perfect food and a more-than-perfect wait-staff.I would definately recommend this restaurant as a special occasion place for a wonderful meal.

name: Rei do Gado
review description: Nice to watch everyone FM COMCON walking by.

name: The Restaurant at Ponte
review description: DO not go to this restaurant in the summer. It is just too hot. We made a reservation for 3 o'clock in the afternoon thinking we would have "linner". I hoped it would be cooling off. It was not. The hostess set us under the misters & at a table where we would "get a cool breeze". I hate misters & it was more like gale force winds.The service was Ok as was the food.From our experience I do not understand the appeal of this place.

name: Rock Bottom Brewery - La Jolla
address: 8980 Villa La Jolla Drive La Jolla, CA  92037
review description: On of the choices on the kids menu was make your own pizza. One of my children wanted to make BBQ Chicken instead of the regular cheese or pepperoni , they accommodated him! We all had such a good time! We are definitely going again!

name: Rock Bottom Brewery - San Diego
review description: Service was good but the food was average.

name: Roppongi
review description: The restaurant had a gluten free menu and lots of options!

name: Roy's La Jolla
review description: Nothing too exciting food was so so, best thing was dessert

name: Roy's San Diego Waterfront
address: 333 West Harbor Drive San Diego, CA  92101
review description: Our waiter, William, was superb. Very professional and warm. We had fireworks over the water just as we were ordering. Very memorable evening. Fabulous food!

name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Del Mar
address: 11582 El Camino Real San Diego, CA  92130
review description: You can always depend on friendly service, consistently high quality, well prepared food. A hit with locals and visitors alike.

name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Diego
address: 1355 North Harbor Drive San Diego, CA  92101
review description: We went to celebrate my husbands 50th birthday. I requested a nice view, we looked at a building. It was disappointing. After being seated the server didn't come to our table for quite some time. While it was a bit busy, it would have been nice to at least be acknowledged. The food was good. The steak was great, however the potatoes were disappointing. They were not cooked completly as they were hard. I have dined there before and I must say I was disappointed, especially since it was a very special occasion.The parking lot was under construction, you only had valet service, for $6. That was also disappointing as you had no choice but to valet.

name: Saiko Sushi
review description: Best sushi restaurant in Coronado. We try to eat there as often as possible. The miso marinated black cod appetizer is out of this world. Try to make reservations because the place is small and fills up quickly. We usually order the King roll (the soft shell crab makes for a unique crunch) and the signature Saiko roll and whatever sashimi is on special. Everything is fresh.

name: Sally's on the Water
review description: My experience at Sally's on the water was fantastic. I went there during Comic Con because the outstanding reviews that it had already received. The smoked scallop chowder was to die for and a great way to start the meal off and was not too heavy of an appetizer. From that I went on to the raw tuna with a seaweed and sesame seed side mixed with a vinaigrette dressing. For the main course I had the grilled seafood platter with a base of hash and side of asparagus. The fish was cooked to perfection. The desert that i had was the Trio de Gelato with the rose flavor being my favorite.I only had one issue with them. It was that the staff starting off was slow to get our orders and serve my group drinks. Thank you for the wonderful food!

name: Saltbox
review description: We celebrated our anniversary at Saltbox and shared several small plates so we could taste it all. The service was fantastic and the food was amazing. You have to try the "Off the Beeten Path" drink. It's delicious and unlike anything we'd ever had! Cheers to Saltbox!

name: Salvatore's Cucina Italiana
review description: Very personal service and attention. The veal dishes were outstanding and the wine was reasonable priced.

name: San Diego Desserts and Bistro
address: 5987 El Cajon Blvd San Diego, CA  92115
review description: It is a nice little place with very friendly staff. Wanted to love it but unfortunately they did not have the quality of food that I would expect for the prices. Ordered the cheese tray and they had a slice of muenster on it along with three other small pieces of cheese. Had to send the toasted bread that they served with it back because it was stale. The caesar salad was terrible. The salmon came with hollandaise sauce on it but wasn't described on the menu. I would only suggest this restaurant for a glass of wine or dessert. It is quaint and cute and they did have live music.

name: Savanna Grill
address: 3773 Willow Glen Drive El Cajon, CA  92010
review description: I have been here for lunch 3x and its so different on the weekend evenings. Daytime brings in the casual breakfast and lunch deals. Extensive menu choices all day and night. Dinner is a bit more expensive unless you go to the back menu pages. The waiter was happy to guide us with a couple recommendations when I asked and was very knowledgeable about the menu and the wine list. In fact it was Exceptional!!! The weekends can get loud with the live music but the band was great and had people dancing next to their tables. Not the place for a quiet romantic dinner, but perfect for good food and a fun evening. The bar area was very busy, drinks were served fast and it looked like everyone was having a good time.

name: Sbicca - Del Mar
review description: Both entrees were exceptional, ahi appetizer awesome, salad not so much. The service was impeccable---Cooper was perfect was his suggestions and engaging. Would definitely make a return visit

name: Sea Rocket Bistro
review description: Had a bit of a problem getting my kid's burger right... What's so difficult about 'a burger & a bun". All the kid wanted was the meat & the bread. It took forever to get his food. He was the last one to eat -- and it still came out with sauce on it.

name: Searsucker
review description: Food was just o.k. The ambience is great, but if you are expecting a great meal, go elsewhere.

name: Sheerwater Restaurant at the Hotel Del Coronado
review description: We ordered a dozen oysters, they brought six, all of which were not shucked properly (we couldn't even separate them from the shell with our dinner forks, no oyster forks provided). We asked for the other six, but they took forever to arrive. Food was OK, not great. The service was unbelievably slow. Definitely request a table outside, which we did. If you are stuck inside, the noise level is ridiculously high because the restaurant opens up to the bar, and if there is live amplified entertainment in the bar, which there was when we were there for dinner, then the restaurant becomes way too noisy. Outside is very beautiful and relatively quiet. We had eaten here one year ago, and loved it. Not this time.

name: Shimbashi Izakaya
address: 1555 Camino Del Mar Suite 201 Del Mar, CA  92014
review description: Fresh, innovative, and delicious sushi tucked away in the Del Mar Plaza. Most definitely a gem of a restaurant I'll return to.

name: The Shores Restaurant - La Jolla Shores Hotel
address: 8110 Camino Del Oro La Jolla, CA  92037
review description: We were a group from the Registrar of Voters and were celebrating five birthdays. We had a wonderful time. Thanks! P.S. the salmon was super.

name: Sky Room at La Valencia Hotel
review description: The knowledge and personality of the staff made the entire experience a lot of fun, and the food was fantastic!

name: Solace & The Moonlight Lounge
review description: Food was very good, service was adequate. Really appreciated the fact that you could have a conversation w/ tablemates. No need to scream over the music or voices of other diners. That was an unexpected bonus!

name: Solare Ristorante Lounge
review description: We needed a place to eat while my brother had a short layover at the airport. The restaurant is a quick hop from the airport and there is ample free parking. Excellent service and the food was delicious. The decor and ambiance were warm and inviting. Wines are reasonably priced, plus on Tuesday, many are discounted by 50%. My brother commented this was a great find. I agree, and will likely return.

name: Soleil @k - San Diego Marriott Gaslamp
review description: Even though this restaurant is tucked away inside the Marriott on 7th Ave downtown San Diego, Ca it has a nice romantic feel to it. We had a great server by the name of Paul and he recommended great food choices and drinks. The Rock Shrimp and Avocado Flatbread is off the meter as a great appetizer. Keep in mind also that they make their own pasta daily. On that note I had the Shrimp Linguini which had a great exotic taste due do the greek olives. Then your server brings you a lovely surprise after your dinner. Wait for it, wait for it....Sorry I can't ruin the surprise. So get on down to Soleil @k.

name: Starlite
review description: This place has great food - the portions were small compared to the price you have to pay for it. Really - close to 6.00 for 5 slices of fried zuchinni? ther drinks were outstanding - recommend you go here for the bar scene.

name: The Steakhouse at Azul La Jolla
review description: THe food was good and n icely presented.

name: Stone Brewing World Bistro & Gardens
review description: We made a special road trip out here for a friend's birthday. Unfortunately, we missed the last tour (4pm), but did settle in on the outside patio for a few rounds of beer (excellent) and some appetizers. The beer list is fantastic, the food is just so-so. The pretzels tasted like they were deep fried, the kim chee was not worthy of being "housemade", and everything is pricey!!! It is worth a trip to experience once, my only gripe (being from LA), is that someone has to drive home!

name: Sycuan Grill - Sycuan Golf and Tennis Resort
review description: We've been here for the BBQ nights before and we loved it. The first time we sat outside and loved everything, this time I got a call about 3 hours before our reservation letting us know there was a private event outside and we'd have to sit inside. We figured it would be fine.

name: Table 926
address: 926 Turquoise Suite H San Diego, CA  92109
review description: Wonderful farm to table chef ownerWould love to have Matt present with dinersMore oftenWe have been there many times and have never met himFranco at Enoteca Adriano also in PB is always coming over to everyoneThat restaurant is wildly successful due to this and their great food

name: Tabule Restaurant & Bar
review description: This is one of our regular haunts. Love it so much that I tell everyone I meet to go there!!

name: Tango Restaurant & Lounge
review description: Everything about our dinner at Tango was great. We had eaten there once before when they first opened and things were even better this time. They are very accomodating, the wait staff was knowlegable and they gave us a booth as we had requested. Even when almost every table was occupied, it wasn't noisy.

name: Tapenade
review description: The food was very nice with the French flair I was expecting. The service was proper and classic. I was impressed on the appetizer portions and the delicate presentations. The food was properly seasoned. My visually impair parent really enjoyed the outside comfort. The noise level was nice. If I would to return I would try other items because the ones we had were so nice. We celebrated my Dad's birthday and we had a pleasant time. We will be back for dinner next time we are in LaJolla.

name: Terra American Bistro
review description: Terra is fast becoming one of my favorite restaurants.I am introducing it to my family and friends.Great healthy food and service.Convenient and easily reached from Hwy 8

name: The Terrace Restaurant & Bar
review description: Too bad they cannot get the service right. The food is very good but had to wait over 25 minutes just to get a drink. Had to ask to have the table wiped and the hostess stopped over to the table and told us a couple of times that they were very busy. Talked to a friend who also visited and ended up leaving because they waited over 15 minutes and could not even get a drink at the bar.

name: TOAST Enoteca & Cucina
review description: The best parts were the wine list by far, followed by the selection of food on the menu which was prepared well and was an eclectic mix of interesting and delicious dishes. The negative was that the menu had at lest a couple of miss-prints that resulted in me getting a dish with surprise ingredients. The staff was all over it and made me a pizza quickly. It was delicious. Be sure to take advantage of the free parking just around the corner on 9th, but not on a day the Padre baseball team is in town.

name: Tom Hams Lighthouse
address: 2150 Harbor Island Dr San Diego, CA  92101
review description: Ambiance on the water. Great views of downtown San Diego. Food just average. Nice presentation but lacking taste.

name: Tommy V's Urban Kitchen
review description: Expected better food frankly. The butternut squash ravioli were really good though the sauce very sweet. The waiter warned me but I liked it.
