However, the sweetness is definitely not for everyone. Fried calamari were excellent. On the downside, the artisan pizza was a disappointment. Felt like a simple flat bread with uncooked arugula. No sauce. Had to return it as it just did not have much taste. The tiramisu was way to moist.

name: Top of the Market
address: 750 North Harbor Drive San Diego, CA  92101
review description: Everything was great, waiter was very good as was the food and everyone else that works there.

name: The Torreyana Grille
address: Hilton La Jolla Torrey Pines 10950 North Torrey Pines Road San Diego, CA  92037
review description: We stopped into the bar before our reservations to have an appetizer and cocktails. When our cocktail waitress was there to provide service, she was good.

name: Trattoria Fantastica
review description: Great food and service. Fun atmosphere too!

name: Trattoria I Trulli
review description: The food and service are exceptional. If you happen to be there on a day when the "Four Cheese Lasagne" is available, DON'T MISS IT!!!

name: Truluck's Seafood, Steak and Crab House - La Jolla
address: 8990 University Center Lane San Diego, CA  92122
review description: Went for our Anniversary. Outstanding food! Customer service was perfect! Recommend to everyone.

name: Tuscany Restaurant Carlsbad
review description: We had a terrific meal. Group of seven heading out got the evening. Everyone enjoyed their meal. I had the lentil soup and Divine Gnocchi, which really was divine. No great view. Sometimes live music. Reasonable prices. :)

name: Twenty/20 Grill & Wine Bar - Sheraton Carlsbad Resort & Spa
review description: Had an excellent Halibut here. Cocktails were good, but very small for the price. Outdoor patio seating area is very nice. Window tables inside are nice too. This restaurant is in a newer Sheraton Hotel.

name: UNION Kitchen & Tap
review description: Great food, our server was perfect! The right blend of helping and leaving us alone. Did was delicious ( you HAVE to try the duck!) a bit noisy, but that's just the type of place Overall ? I'd go back - if that tells you anything and would recommend this spot to friends.

name: Urban Bar & Grill
review description: They handled our large group with two food allergies (chicken and gluten) with ease. The waitstaff went above and beyond and the food was delicious. I would recommend them in a heartbeat.

name: Urban Solace
review description: Everything was great. I was hoping sitting outside would be a little less noisy but there were definitely moments when we couldn't hear each other speak (due to the traffic on the streets and the music). Other than that everything was GREAT!

name: URBN Coal Fired Pizza
review description: I enjoy dining at URBN more so than Basic though the food selection is basically the same. I really really dig the couch seating (great for big groups) and it's not so loud in there that you can't hold a conversation (which is I often feel at Basic). The bourbon cocktail is killer! Love the spicy hot wings and the sausage stuffed pepper pizza. Will definitely be back again and again!

name: Vail Ranch Steakhouse
review description: The food was great..customer services was excellent... and well worth the price....

name: Vela
address: Hilton Bayfront 1 Park Boulevard San Diego, CA  92101
review description: Jorge was the prefect waiter and the chefs preparation was top rate. Food options should keep the vast majority very happy. Portion size was perfect to make it a dinning experience vice a stuffing. Mai tai was great.

name: Veranda Fireside Lounge & Restaurant
address: 17550 Bernardo Oaks Dr San Diego, CA  92128
review description: This was my husband and my favorite place for breakfast and lunch. We would come to relax and enjoy the scenery of the golf course (my husband was a golf lover) and enjoy a glass of wine and good food. After he died, I had trouble coming back but eventually wanted to share the beauty of the place. When I started my meet up group "The Young 60's" I knew that I would bring them to the Veranda for coffee and breakfast. They loved it and we might make it one of our coffee places. The food is great, the service is wonderful and this is a place to put on your list as favorites.

name: Via Italia Trattoria
address: 569 S. Coast Highway 101 Encinitas, CA 92024 Encinitas, CA  92024
review description: Excellent calzone and lasagne. Also able to cater to my wife's gluten free needs. Will come again next time in town.

name: Via Lago Trattoria
address: 866 Eastlake Pkwy, Ste 210 Chula Vista, CA  91914
review description: After waiting to find out who our server was the dinning experience started and was average the owner sat in front of us didn't one ask about service food etc traveled a long distance to see a singer perform if this place was close to home it wouldn't get my repeat business,,,

name: Vigilucci's Ristorante Coronado
review description: we wanted to try this after seeing a play in San Diego; we brought friends and were very disappointed. Maybe this was just a bad day and we will give the one in a Lecudia a try sometime. Service was and staff was very attentive, we just had a bad experience with the food

name: Vigilucci's Seafood & Steakhouse
review description: A lovely setting for 3 friends to have a leisurely lunch.

name: Villa Capri
address: 2330 Proctor Valley Rd. #101 Chula Vista, CA  91914
review description: There were 7 of us. All was excellent. Food, Service, Ambiance. Could not have asked for a better dinner with the family.

name: Villa Capri Ristorante
address: 3870 Valley Centre Dr San Diego, CA  92130
review description: While not "knock your socks off" food, uses fresh, good quality ingredients to produce enjoyable meals. Prices are reasonable -- portions are of good size (share a salad). Recommended.

name: Vincent's
review description: Vincent,s is a fabulous restaurant. The food is some of the best I have experienced. We felt like we were in Vincent's home for a special dinner party. He visits each table to chat, and makes you feel special. The beef wellington was perfectly prepared. His sauces compliment the entre' without over powering the flavor of the meat. 5 star in every respect!

name: Vineyard Rose at South Coast Winery
review description: While on a trip to Southern California area, we spent an evening dining at South Coast Winery. We found the entrance landscaping very nice and inviting which made us feel welcome. We chose to be seated outside on a covered deck overlooking rest of grounds and found the view to be nice. Service was fantastic as our server gave us alot of attention, but was not constantly bothering us. We did not feel rushed. We ordered appetizer of Coconut Shrimp with excellent wine. My wife ordered the clam chowder and I had the vineyard salad with fresh mozzarella which was quite tasty. I had the New York Strip and my wife had the Sea Bass and both were very good. We ended by each having an excellent dessert with a nice port. Overall, the atmosphere, meal,

name: Vintana Wine & Dine
review description: In an area that is sadly lacking in fine cuisine, Vintana brings a breath of fresh air to North County. While unusual to have a restaurant atop a car dealership, they have done an amazing job with the decor, and the ambiance is wonderful. As usual, with a Deborah Scott restaurant, the flavors of the food were wonderful with a wide variety to choose from. We will definitely be returning to Vintana.

name: Vinz Wine Bar
review description: Great place to meet and eat but they have screwed our reservation pretty much every time. I specifically request an outside table when booking via Opentable but this wasn't acknowledged, even though my message was on the screen when I checked in. Not good enough. Love the place, the beers, wine, appetizers and pizza but they've made mistakes with both my and friends' reservations too frequently. C'mon Vinz - Tango is snapping at your heels!

name: Vivace - Park Hyatt Aviara
review description: We were pleasantly surprised by Vivant. We had arrived at the hotel late and were expecting an average hotel-restaurant meal. But Vivant delivered much more. Our waitress was knowledgable and pleasant. She recommended the octapus carpaccio which was amazing. The lamb papperdelle was also outstanding. It is clear that the chef is inventive and quite talented. We will be back.

name: The Wellington
address: 729 W. Washington St. San Diego, CA  92103
review description: We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner and the live music. The restaurant is small and intimate, though a bit dark. I loved the Laphroaig Scotch and Vodka martini! They stuff their own blue cheese oliver. The veggies come from their own garden, and the homemade bread was wonderful.

name: West Steak and Seafood
review description: The best steak house in North County! Great food, great service, what more can I say?

name: The Westgate Hotel - Sunday Brunch & Le Fontainebleau Room
review description: I will never understand why HR recruits people that are not customer service oriented. I felt like he was doing us a favor....The bus boy came to offer some pastries and my friend and I talked at the same time to him, he rudely replied "I cannot listen to you when you are both speaking at the same time"...Food was so, so... I thought it would be at the level of other brunches, like La Valencia or Hotel Del (for the price). Maybe if service was better, I would've felt food was better. I was also surprised that their valet parking offered only 3 dlls validation.....La Valencia and Hotel Del, which are on the top of my list, offered complimentary parking to their guests...with proper validation...It was my birthday, was a so so experience...

name: The Westgate Hotel - The Westgate Room
review description: Experience was optimum in every way.

name: The Whaling Bar & Grill at La Valencia Hotel
review description: Food was outstanding. Try the Paella , awesome. Always a great atmosphere and great for an occasion!

name: Whisknladle
review description: WhisknLadle was the hot spot. Lively scene. A little loud once they were full. Our tables was ready and waiting. We made reservations for 6pm and we needed to push back to 6:15pm. WnL was most gracious. Our server was very patient. I had out of town guests - some were out of the country guests. Jeremiah helped us thru the menu. Everything was presented well and tasted delish. The Summer salad stole the show. Corn, Avo and grapefruit. The salad completely captured the essence of summer in California. The only down side was the parking. We parked at a lot the advertised $5 all day (Hotel Paresi) In fact they charged us $12 and were considered preferred parking for WnL. What's up with that? Anyway we will be back - maybe we will take the bus!

name: Wild Note Cafe
address: 143 S. Cedros Ave. Suite T Solana Beach, CA  92075
review description: The service was super!!!! It is very low key. Really a neighborhood restaurant. I was not expecting it. But the food was good.

name: The WineSellar & Brasserie
address: 9550 Waples Street, Suite 115 San Diego, CA  92121
review description: Always a solid choice for dining out. Interesting menu, fabulous wines. Went for the Bastille Day menu and wine pairing. Even at lunch the food is well prepared, the meal well timed and thoroughly enjoyable. The hard part is getting out of the place without spending a lot of money in the wine shop downstairs!

name: Woody's Solana Beach
review description: Went on Monday night, bar was 1/3 full and restaurant was about half full, mostly with 2-tops. Waiter service was below average on attentiveness and friendliness.

name: World Famous
address: 711 Pacific Beach Dr. San Diego, CA  92109
review description: Fabulous view, wonderful food and great service... Highly recommend! We ate dinner and watched the sunset. Gorgeous...
